alert.note: Alert for Ionia (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 05 at 3:49PM EDT until April 09 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Rapids MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... Grand River at Lansing affecting Ingham County. Grand River at Ionia affecting Ionia County. Grand River at Lowell affecting Kent County. Grand River at Ada affecting Kent County. Grand River at Grand Rapids affecting Kent County. Looking Glass River Near Eagle affecting Clinton County. .Another round of heavy rain has fallen across Lower Michigan. Rainfall totals in the last 24 hours are around 1.5 inches across much of the Grand River basin. This will worsen and prolong the high water conditions that many areas are already experiencing, and bring additional locations above flood stage over the next few days. Generally dry weather will prevail through the weekend, so once this water works through the rivers the water levels should finally start to drop. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Grand River at Ionia. * WHEN...From late tonight to early Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Expect moderate flooding of several roads, businesses, and residences, in the Ionia area and of structures located in the Ionia Fairgrounds. Water halfway up windows on automobile building at Ionia Fairgrounds. Water begins to flood parking lot of Dollar General store, Save-a-Lot, and the Ionia Secretary of State office. Homes along Quarry Road begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM EDT Wednesday the stage was 20.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 22.6 feet Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.1 feet on 04/08/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr.
